interfaces

Class InvestmentInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • interfaces.InvestmentInterface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    class InvestmentInterface
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class for the investments interface. Deals with buying and selling stocks and mutual funds.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ATM atm
      The ATM that the interface is running on.

      The scanner attribute that is used for inputs.

    • Method Detail

      • displayInvestmentMenu

        public void displayInvestmentMenu(User user)
        The investment menu that the user will see in the interface.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that wants to view the investment menu

      • printOptions

        private void printOptions()
        The options that the user can pick from in the investments interface.

      • buyStocks

        private void buyStocks(User user)
        Allows the user to buy stocks. Will ask the user to input the stock symbol and the number of shares they wish to buy.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that wants to buy stocks

      • sellStocks

        private void sellStocks(User user)
        Allows the user to sell stocks. Will ask the user to input the stock symbol and the number of shares they wish to sell.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that wants to sell stocks

      • buyMutualFunds

        private void buyMutualFunds(User user)
        Allows the user to buy mutual funds. Will ask the user which fund they would like to invest in and the amount they would like to buy.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that wants to buy the mutual funds

      • sellMutualFunds

        private void sellMutualFunds(User user)
        Allows the user to sell mutual funds. Will ask the user which fund they would like to sell and the amount they would like to sell.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that wants to sell mutual funds

      • listFunds

        private MutualFund listFunds()
        Allows the user to select the type of fund. Either a low risk, medium risk or high risk fund.
        Returns:
        The fund the user has selected

      • viewUserMutualFunds

        private void viewUserMutualFunds(User user)
        Allows the user to view all the mutual funds they have invested in. They will be allowed to see the fund name, and the amount they have invested in the fund.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that would like to view their mutual funds

      • findMutualFund

        private MutualFund findMutualFund(User user,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        Returns the mutual fund that is in the user's mutual funds portfolio. Returns null if the mutual fund is not in the user's mutual funds portfolio.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that would like to find the mutual fund
        name - the name of the fund that the user wants to find
        Returns:
        the mutual fund that the user wants to find, null if the mutual fund is not found in the user's portfolio

      • findStockAccount

        private Asset findStockAccount(User user)
        Returns the user's stock account. Each user will only have one stock account.
        Parameters:
        user - the user that would like to find their stock account
        Returns:
        the stock account

      • writeObject

        private void writeObject(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Used in serialization to store the InvestmentInterface object.
        Parameters:
        oos - instance of the ObjectOutputStream class to serlialize the investment interface object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

      • readObject

        private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream ois)
                 throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                        java.io.IOException
        Used in serialization to restore the investment interface's information after the ATM is restarted.
        Parameters:
        ois - instance of the ObjectInputStream class used to deserialize object
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the serialized object could not be found
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs

      • readObjectNoData

        private void readObjectNoData()
                       throws java.io.ObjectStreamException
        Used in serialization when class inheritance is not as expected*
        Throws:
        java.io.ObjectStreamException - when an attempt to deserialize a back-reference fails
